Al-Nassr postpone China friendlies as Ronaldo injured before Inter Miami clashCristiano Ronaldo's Al-Nassr have cancelled their two-game China tour after the forward suffered an injury, the Saudi club said on Tuesday, sparking concern over the Portuguese's participation in their upcoming encounter against Lionel Messi's Inter Miami. Tue, 23 Jan 2024 17:26:41 GMT WEWCP7GGSJMCHBN7V2OZNVFMBE https://www.reuters.com/sports/soccer/al-nassr-postpones-china-friendlies-ronaldo-injured-before-inter-miami-clash-2024-01-23/Reuters运动的足球
US-listed China stocks bounce off lows on hopes of Beijing supportNew York-listed shares of Chinese companies bounced back on Tuesday after a dour start to the year, after a report of a rescue package for the slumping domestic stock market buoyed sentiment. Tue, 23 Jan 2024 16:07:16 GMT M667DOIAWRL2DDLWMS2AL2DXM4 https://www.reuters.com/markets/us/us-listed-china-stocks-bounce-off-lows-hopes-beijing-support-2024-01-23/Medha Singh市场美国市场
Jack Ma bought Alibaba shares worth $50 mln in fourth quarter - NYTAlibaba co-founder Jack Ma and Chairman Joe Tsai bought millions worth of shares in the Chinese e-commerce giant in the fourth quarter, the New York Times reported on Tuesday, sending the company's U.S.-listed shares up around 7%. Tue, 23 Jan 2024 15:23:22 GMT A5PCJLFYUFIQTC3Z6HADH4LCUE https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/jack-ma-bought-alibaba-shares-worth-50-mln-fourth-quarter-2024-01-23/Reuters商业零售与消费品
Maldives says Chinese vessel will not conduct research in its watersA Chinese research vessel on its way to the Maldives will not conduct any research while in the archipelago's waters in the Indian Ocean, the Maldivian foreign ministry said on Tuesday. Tue, 23 Jan 2024 14:29:11 GMT YRMSOYO2FFODVOPVMOADWShaiy https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/maldives-says-chinese-vessel-will-not-conduct-research-its-waters-2024-01-23/Reuters世界亚太地区
Investors give up futile wait for China to fix economyFrom hope to hesitancy and now total capitulation, global investors in China are heading for the exits in the world's second-biggest economy and sending its stock market crashing. Tennis-Alcaraz gears up for Zverev examination in MelbourneSecond seed Carlos Alcaraz faces arguably the toughest test of his Australian Open campaign when he faces Germany's Alexander Zverev in the quarter-finals at Melbourne Park on Wednesday, in a match that promises to be a fascinating clash of styles. Tue, 23 Jan 2024 13:07:09 GMT GRMETUFP2BMEPKN3EPUJ2Y2NVE https://www.reuters.com/sports/tennis/tennis-alcaraz-gears-up-zverev-exam-melbourne-2024-01-23/Reuters运动的网球
Philippines Marcos says does not endorse Taiwan independence, seeks to avoid conflictPhilippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said he does not endorse Taiwan independence and reiterated his country was committed to its One-China policy, a response to China's outrage over recent remarks in congratulating Taiwan's election winner. Tue, 23 Jan 2024 12:05:38 GMT 5ZAV3MCPZRL23PPEXURL5IUJR4 https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippines-marcos-says-does-not-endorse-taiwan-independence-seeks-avoid-2024-01-23/Reuters世界亚太地区
P&G's strong margins take heat off annual profit forecast cutProcter & Gamble cut its annual profit forecast on Tuesday to reflect a writedown in the value of its Gillette business, but the company's ability to maintain healthy margins during the second quarter pushed its shares up more than 5%. 3M annual profit forecast squeezed by sluggish electronics, China demandIndustrial conglomerate 3M forecast full-year earnings below Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, saying the macro environment "remains muted" and sending its shares plunging about 12%. Italy looks to use G7 chair to boost support for Ukraine, scrutinise AIItaly will use its presidency of the Group of Seven major democracies to challenge growing perceptions that Russia is winning in Ukraine and that the West is tiring of the war, a source familiar with Italy's G7 plans said. Exclusive: Fortescue faces rare delays for China iron ore customs clearance - sourcesAt least two iron ore cargoes from the world's No.4 supplier Fortescue Metals Group are facing unusual customs delays at north China's Caofeidian port due to inspections for solid waste, sources with knowledge of the matter said.
